title: m140506_102106_rbac_init.php doesn't consider different schemas than dbo for MS SQL Server

labels.name: status:ready for adoption
labels.description: Feel free to implement this issue.

body:
### What steps will reproduce the problem?

1. In Yii2 config files set following configuration for authManager.

```
        'authManager' => [
            'class' => '\yii\rbac\DbManager',
            'itemTable' => '{{yii.auth_item}}',
            'itemChildTable' => '{{yii.auth_item_child}}',
            'assignmentTable' => '{{yii.auth_assignment}}',
            'ruleTable' => '{{yii.auth_rule}}',
        ],
```

2. Run migrations for RBAC using `php yii migrate --migrationPath=@yii/rbac/migration`

### What is the expected result?

All migrations pass successfully.

### What do you get instead?

Migration fails because it cannot create a trigger. Because following code:

```php
        if ($this->isMSSQL()) {
            $this->execute("CREATE TRIGGER dbo.trigger_auth_item_child
            ON dbo.{$authManager->itemTable}
            INSTEAD OF DELETE, UPDATE
            AS
            DECLARE @old_name VARCHAR (64) = (SELECT name FROM deleted)
            DECLARE @new_name VARCHAR (64) = (SELECT name FROM inserted)
            BEGIN
            IF COLUMNS_UPDATED() > 0
                BEGIN
                    IF @old_name <> @new_name
                    BEGIN
                        ALTER TABLE {$authManager->itemChildTable} NOCHECK CONSTRAINT FK__auth_item__child;
                        UPDATE {$authManager->itemChildTable} SET child = @new_name WHERE child = @old_name;
                    END
                UPDATE {$authManager->itemTable}
                SET name = (SELECT name FROM inserted),
                type = (SELECT type FROM inserted),
                description = (SELECT description FROM inserted),
                rule_name = (SELECT rule_name FROM inserted),
                data = (SELECT data FROM inserted),
                created_at = (SELECT created_at FROM inserted),
                updated_at = (SELECT updated_at FROM inserted)
                WHERE name IN (SELECT name FROM deleted)
                IF @old_name <> @new_name
                    BEGIN
                        ALTER TABLE {$authManager->itemChildTable} CHECK CONSTRAINT FK__auth_item__child;
                    END
                END
                ELSE
                    BEGIN
                        DELETE FROM dbo.{$authManager->itemChildTable} WHERE parent IN (SELECT name FROM deleted) OR child IN (SELECT name FROM deleted);
                        DELETE FROM dbo.{$authManager->itemTable} WHERE name IN (SELECT name FROM deleted);
                    END
            END;");
        }
```

Assumes that tables are in **dbo** schema. Yet auth manager tables are in **yii** schema. 

One fix would be parsing table names and checking if the schema is different than **dbo**.

Current workaround is to copy this migration to the project and change this part manually.

### Additional info

| Q                | A
| ---------------- | ---
| Yii version      | 2.0.15
| PHP version      | 7.1.18 
| Operating system | Ubuntu 16.04.1
